definition: to be caught off guard/without warning
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: This catches me a little off guard.
sentences.chinese: 這番話讓我有點猝不及防。

sentences.english: As I said, pandemics are unpredictable and prone to deliver surprises.
sentences.chinese: 如我所說，大流行是變幻莫測的，往往令人猝不及防。

sentences.english: By surprise in the face of financial crisis, weak hard to resist.
sentences.chinese: 面對猝不及防的金融危機，勢單力薄難以抵禦。

sentences.english: Tripping is used in the Praying Mantis Kung Fu style to catch an opponent off guard.
sentences.chinese: 跳閘是用在螳螂拳功夫風格來捕捉對手猝不及防。

sentences.english: The sheer unexpectedness of it made my hair stir under my cap.
sentences.chinese: 這猝不及防的驚變，使我帽子下面的頭髮都豎起來。

sentences.english: It was a quick kayo, and Wilbur was the new champ.
sentences.chinese: 威爾伯猝不及防的一擊，使他成爲新拳擊冠軍。

definition: no time to deal with it (idiom); caught unprepared
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
omen/sign (of sth yet to occur)/prior indication/to foreshadow
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
